Title: Cyber Security Specialist
Description:
About Us
Breez is cannabis for everyday life. We create products that unlock the benefits of cannabis for everyone. We launched in 2015 from our kitchen table and built the company to one of the world's top cannabis brands. Our bestselling mints, tablets and tincture sprays have redefined cannabis consumption and led the way for making cannabis more accessible. We are growing fast, expanding into new categories, and looking for the right talent to join this high-performance team.
Our growing team is made up of extraordinary individuals who have created a culture of collaboration, excellence, and respect. We promote from within and seek to provide meaningful opportunities for learning and growth. This is an apolitical workplace where we honor individuality, value free thinking and respect civil liberties. We are an equal opportunity employer.
Learn more at findbreez.com
Position Summary
We are seeking an IT Director to join one of the top manufacturers/distributors in the cannabis industry. This position reports directly to the CEO and CFO. This leadership role will be responsible for all aspects of our Information Systems, Systems Design, IT Security, developing the strategy and roadmap for the department and ongoing support for mission critical systems.
Ideal candidates will direct and coordinate information systems planning and design, programming, installation and operations. They will drive the implementation of technology that fosters scale in support of a rapid growth agenda. This is an exciting opportunity for a technology leader who is passionate about working for a growing organization in a complex industry.
Responsibilities
Manages data center and hosting operations as well as business continuity / disaster recovery planning and test execution.
Contributes to the design and approval of a comprehensive security strategy. The strategy will account for the end-to-end lifecycle of information security operations, including: Evaluating the IT threat landscape, devising policy and controls to reduce risk, and leading auditing and compliance initiatives.
Translates the security risk requirements and constraints of the business into technical control requirements and specifications, as well as develops metrics for ongoing performance measurement and reporting.
Designs and implements internal communications security systems including a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) management ecosystem, in order to enforce data security as it relates to employee personal devices used to interact on company networks, and systems to manage company phone conferencing software.
Coordinates with all relevant department managers to enforce authorized access by investigating improper access; revoking access; reporting violations and recommending improvements for all digital and physical facility access points.
Coordinates with Distribution and Fleet managers to enforce authorized vehicle access and tracking by investigating improper access, revoking access, reporting violations and recommending improvements for all digital and physical fleet access points.
Conducts audits with internal and external auditors and makes recommendations as needed to improve compliance and the security culture.
Is fully accountable for the management, maintenance, and configuration of endpoint security protection, intrusion prevention/detection systems, vulnerability management systems, data loss prevention, and others.
Ensures that the organization is adaptable to evolving compliance regulations including PCI, GDPR, CCPA, develop the requirements for all interested parties and coordinate with the data protection initiatives in compliance with these requirements as per the enforceable regulations.
Researches, drafts, and drives process change for policy and security solutions to better serve our customers.
Acts as the primary contact for executives and senior management (internal and external), providing guidance and advice related to technology controls and regulatory compliance.
Qualifications
Cover Letter Required
10+ years of experience leading and managing Information Security Engineering and Operations
General security background in the use of cryptography, network/systems/physical security, authentication, authorization, and usability
Financial acumen with experience developing business cases for IT investment
Experience negotiating contracts with IT vendors and service providers
Agile and dev/ops experience preferred
Strong organizational, multi-tasking and interpersonal skills.
Superior verbal, written, and presentation skills
Salary
The compensation package for this position includes a competitive base salary commensurate with experience.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: Up to $150,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Health insurance
Paid time off
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Experience:
Cybersecurity: 10 years (Preferred)
Work Location:
One location
Work Remotely:
No
Work Location: One location

Title: Associate IT Auditor (July 2022)
Description:
Overview
PDI helps convenience retailers and petroleum wholesalers thrive through digital transformation and enterprise software that enables them to grow topline revenue, optimize operations and unify their business across the entire value chain.
Over 1,500 customers in more than 200,000 locations worldwide count on our leading payments, marketing & insights cloud, ERP, logistics, fuel pricing, and security solutions to provide insights that increase volume, margin, and customer loyalty, all while connecting the digital ecosystem and protecting data. For more than 35 years, our comprehensive suite of solutions and unmatched expertise have helped customers reimagine their enterprise and deliver exceptional customer experiences. Backed by the investment of TA Associates, Genstar, and Insight Capital Partners, PDI is embarking upon an aggressive expansion strategy through internal investment in development as well as intensive M&A activity. The result will be a broader, more powerful, global company that serves customers across the entire supply chain.
Job Description:
The Security Administrator position works closely with the Application Analyst and Security Analyst teams to setup, configure, implement, and maintain the security of applications, systems, networks, and environments. Security Administrators provide feedback on risk and security posture of applications, systems, services, and networks, as well as recommendations for reducing risk and improving security posture.
This position will perform assessment, mitigation, and remediation for identified vulnerabilities. All vulnerabilities are required to be addressed during a specific timeline set based on severity.
Security Administrators participate in security audits, such as Payment Card Industry (PCI) Compliance and Service Organization Control (SOC) audits by collecting and submitting evidence to auditors. They must be knowledgeable in security best practices, industry security standards and related auditing requirements.
Security Administrators must always practice due care and due diligence in their job role.
Responsibilities and Tasks:
Review and secure software configurations ensuring the proper security controls are present
Secure and administer dedicated and cloud-based Linux, Windows, and Mac servers, ensuring the proper security requirements are present
Secure and administer dedicated and cloud-based networks ensuring the proper security controls are present
Troubleshoot complex application, system, service, and network issues.
Research, Assess, Mitigate, Remediate, Validate and Report on identified vulnerabilities.
Evaluate and report on risk to various teams and management
Implement, review, and provide guidance on access controls for applications, systems, services, and networks
Support security audits for internal resources, partners and third parties
Provide guidance on security best practices
Create and maintain technical documentation for security processes, tasks, and network infrastructure
Coordinate patching and security maintenance schedule with various teams
Analyze security requirements and provide recommendations on them
SSL Certificate management
Assist with auditing security controls
Integrate security standards and best practices into CI/CD pipeline
Technical Skills and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field (or relevant work experience)
5+ years server/network administration experience
3+ years computer security experience
In-depth knowledge of Linux and Windows
Knowledge of industry compliance and privacy standards (NIST, PCI, GDPR, CCPA, etc)
Firewall management experience
Load Balancer management experience
Other Skills and Experience
Communicate clearly and effectively with global teams
Create clear and easy to understand documentation
Security Automation
Experience with dedicated and cloud hosted infrastructure
Experience with creating and deploying Amazon Web Services
AWS Certification is a plus
Professional Certification(s), such as Security+, CISSP, CCSP, CISA

Title: Jr Cybersecurity Analyst

Lead day-to-day hunt execution and serve as an escalation point for complex technical issues

Identify gaps or vulnerabilities in security systems, network devices, and controls to validate effectiveness and configuring of security devices and tools; assign appropriate SLAs to drive system compliance and remediation efforts
Use hunt execution strategies to identify, analyze, correlate, mitigate, track, and develop content for tools and processes related to indicators of comprise

Train Cyber Threat Analysts in the process and technical skills needed for threat hunting

Title: COMPUTER ASSISTANT (CYBERSECURITY)
Company: US US Army Financial Management Command
Location: Joint Base Lewis McChord, WA+1 location
Description:
2+ years of experience in an information analyst role or similar, working with databases and query languages.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to adapt messaging to executive, technical, and non-technical audiences.
Ring is seeking a qualified Security Analyst to join Ring’s Insider Threat Security Program. In this role, you will work with Ring’s security engineers, incident response team, key business stakeholders, and service teams across the organization to detect, respond to, and manage potential threat activity of internal origin. The ideal candidate is highly motivated and dynamic with the ability to combine data analytics with behavioral and systems context to rapidly qualify and drive potential threats to resolution. As a Security Analyst you will work closely with the owners of various production services to understand the roles of the various users of their systems, identify outlying behavior, investigate, and escalate appropriately.

Responsibilities:
Work with functional managers and engineers on the software teams to help build threat models around various roles.
Develop playbooks for alerts.
Create simulated threat actor profiles to monitor tools for effectiveness and expected functionality.
Work with engineers on your team to improve detection logic and tuning.
Synthesize information from multiple telemetry streams to identify potential threats to systems.
Be part of an on-call rotation as needed.
Relevant work experience in internet-based risk, abuse, fraud, data protection, or security.
Experience working with contact centers.
Experience working as part of a Computer Security Incident Response Team.
Hands-on experience working with AWS Services (S3, Athena, Kinesis).
Experience working with PR and Legal teams around sensitive matters.
Analytical ability to break down complex problems, and a strong will to get things done and deliver results.
Self driven analytical mindset, interested in conducting exploratory data analysis.
Ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format and to present findings in a clear and concise manner.
About Ring
Since its founding in 2013, Ring has been on a mission to make neighborhoods safer. From the video doorbell, to Ring Alarm, which was named #1 in Customer Satisfaction for DIY Home Security Systems by J.D. Power, Ring’s smart home security product line, as well as the Neighbors App, offer users affordable whole-home and neighborhood security. At Ring, we are committed to making home and neighborhood security accessible and effective for everyone -- while working hard to bring communities together. Ring is an Amazon company. For more information, visit www.ring.com. With Ring, you’re always home.

JOB DESCRIPTION
Job Title: SOC Security Analyst I
*This position can be remote*

POSITION PROFILE
This position provides direct support to the business and IT staff for Security Operations Center(SOC) related issues. Responsible for analyzing security related logs and events for potential malicious content and actions. Represents the security needs of the organization by providing assistance in projects as needed with regard to security issues. This role is primarily focused on operational security monitoring.

JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Works with limited supervision to monitor security-relevant logs and alerts for signs of compromise, attack, or system misuse and policy violations.
Team with third party MSSP to perform Tier-2 triage and collect related data from various network and system analysis systems, review available open and closed source information on related threats and vulnerabilities, prepare initial summary reports
Ensure all alerts are monitored, interpreted, analyzed, and investigated.
Analyze network flow data for anomalies and correlate reporting with enterprise-wide network activity.
Document key event details and analytic findings in a security operations management system. Prepares status reports on security matters to help develop security risk analysis scenarios and response procedures.
Monitors and assists on information security issues related to the systems and workflow to ensure the internal security controls for the business are appropriate and operating as intended.
Serves as a team member for projects / programs within a defined area of responsibility and/or on a cross-functional team.
Participates with the CSIRT team in response to information security incidents.
Assists with the development and publishing of Information Security policies, procedures, standards and guidelines based on knowledge of best practices and compliance requirements.
Conducts security research to stay abreast of current security issues.
Performs other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS (Education, Experience, and Certifications)
Requires technical degree, certification or equivalent experience.
Requires 1-3 years of experience with information security.
Requires knowledge of security issues, techniques and implications across existing computer systems.
Ability to read, understand and troubleshoot system data, including, but not limited to, security event logs, system logs, and firewall logs.
Working knowledge of application and infrastructure security solutions (Firewalls, Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems, Network Security, Password Management, Data Encryption, and Access Control).
